column4: Hi, I can't install msttcorefonts... I don't really need it , but I can't remove it too http://pastebin.ubuntu-nl.org/51196/
How are you trying to remove msttcorefonts?
Does synaptic show it as installed?
: yes
Have you tried to remove it from there?
: yes
Does it give you an error or tell you what to do to fix it?
: every time I try to remove it it starts with "pre-removal script" that is the same "post-install"
I take it you are cancelling it out at that point?
: I left it go... But when finished it says that some of the *.exe cab is corrupted and gives me: "pre-removal script sub-process has given error code1"
SOmething odd here...How were they installed.  and if you say you used automatix or envy scripts to install anything I am gonna scream..
: I stay away from Envy or Automatix
: It was installed as a dependency of ubuntu-restricted-extras
Good to know you never tried or used automatix...  We have seen way to many problems these last couple days.  Are you running something under wine in the background ?
:  ps aux | grep wine ........ nothing
Oh, and is this a real install or some vm optional setup?
:  Real install... As I've done it many times before...
Sorry , I am at a loss on this.. maybe after I finish my morning coffee I will have something, hopefully you will get an answer before that.
:  Is there any way I can tell apt-get to remove but don't do configure (pre-remove)???
You can purge it, but my concern is the corrupt *.exe cab files... this problem is the tip of the iceberg
Are you running the repo version of wine or an upgraded version
:  Sorry... I was googling... I have no wine installed, but I don't think it's needed, it uses cabextract to install fonts
